Welcome to Chitter’s documentation!¶

This is the documentation of the INB356, 2014/2 Assignment between Brett Orr and Kannon Chan.

Chitter.py – Documentation¶

class Chitter.chitter.Chitter¶

The main Chitter server object.

Available Endpoints are: /index: Index page. /prepare(search): Prepare the streamer. /stream: Get the latest tweet. /stop: Stop the streamer. /clear: Clear the internal data. /cloud: Return a cloud tag.

Chitter.chitter.gen_cloud(tags)¶

Simple cloud tag generator based on the weight of any given word in a dictionary of terms.

Args:
tags (arr): The array of tags to generate a cloud from.
class Chitter.chitter.listener(api=None)¶

Simple Class for Listening to the Twitter stream.

Args:
StreamListener: The type of Stream Listener to use.
on_data(data)¶

Controls receiving data from the Twitter Stream. When the data is received, and if we’re not stopped, get the text and add to the tweets array. Then take the hashtags (if any), and combine into the global Hashtag string.

Args:
data (str): The JSON data (string format) received from the stream.
on_error(status)¶

Handles errors in the stream.

Args:
status (str): The Error received.

Naives.py – Documentation¶

Chitter.naives.extractFeatures(tweet)¶

Extract features from the tweet.

Args:
tweet: The tweet text to analyze.
Chitter.naives.getFeatureVector(tweet, stopWords)¶

Get features of the tweet. Args:

tweet: The tweet text to analyze.

stopWords: The list of stop words.

Chitter.naives.getStopWordList(stopWordListFileName)¶

Load the stop words list.

Args:
stopWordListFileName: The filename of the .txt with the stop words.
Chitter.naives.replaceDouble(s)¶

Look for 2 or more repetitions of character and replace with the character itself

Args:
s: The text to analyze.
Chitter.naives.simplify(tweet)¶

Simplifies tweet before extraction.

Args:
tweet: The text of the tweet to simplify.
Chitter.naives.testTweet(classifier, tweet)¶

Using the classifer, take the tweet and determine its sentiment.

Args:
classifier: What classifier to use. tweet: The Tweet text.
